doc.previous: The influence of Jacques Louis David can be seen in the painting s scale in the sculptural tautness of the figures and in the heightened manner in which a particularly significant fruitful moment the first awareness of the approaching ship is described 23 In 1793 David also painted an important current event with The Death of Marat His painting had an enormous political impact during the time of the revolution in France and it served as an important precedent for G ricault s decision to also paint a current event David s pupil Antoine Jean Gros had like David represented the grandiosities of a school irredeemably associated with a lost cause 41 but in some major works he had given equal prominence to Napoleon and anonymous dead or dying figures 31 42 G ricault had been particularly impressed by the 1804 painting Bonaparte Visiting the Plague Victims of Jaffa by Gros 7
doc.after: The young G ricault had painted copies of work by Pierre Paul Prud hon 1758 1823 whose thunderously tragic pictures include his masterpiece Justice and Divine Vengeance Pursuing Crime where oppressive darkness and the compositional base of a naked sprawled corpse obviously influenced G ricault s painting 35
